item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Horace
item.description:
"Carpe diem, quam minimum credula postero."
(<i>Odes: I.11</i>)" -- Horace

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Winter is coming." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by George R. R. Martin
item.description: "Sleep is good, he said, And books are better." -- George R. R. Martin

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "When you play a game of thrones you win or you die." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them. In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wished to be loved by another,' [Éowyn] answered. 'But I desire no man's pity." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "What do you fear, lady?" [Aragorn] asked. "A cage," [Éowyn] said. "To stay behind bars, until use and old age accept them, and all chance of doing great deeds is gone beyond recall or desire." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "You cannot pass," he said. The orcs stood still, and a dead silence fell. "I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udûn. Go back to the Shadow! You cannot pass." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Whitelady3 add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
